summary: In this context, Butane-2,3-dione, also known as diacetyl, is identified as a specific chemical associated with occupational exposure among flavoring manufacturing workers. The study highlights health issues, particularly respiratory symptoms and lung function abnormalities, linked to exposure to flavoring chemicals, including diacetyl. This indicates a direct relevance of Butane-2,3-dione as a chemical of concern in the workplace, emphasizing the need for reduced exposure to such chemicals to protect worker health.
